meanings.sent1: She wanted to expunge all traces of the mistake from her record.
meanings.sent2: The computer technician had to expunge the virus from the system.
meanings.sent3: He tried to expunge the embarrassing photo, but it kept reappearing.
meanings.sent4: The artist used bold strokes to expunge any hint of doubt from the painting.
meanings.sent5: The detective needed to expunge the false leads to solve the case.

meanings.sent1: The flood threatened to expunge the entire village from the map.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire had the power to expunge acres of forest in a matter of hours.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to expunge the carefully arranged pillows.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury seemed to expunge all signs of civilization from the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The dictator aimed to expunge any opposition to his rule.

meanings.sent1: The new software could expunge the need for manual data entry.
meanings.sent2: The powerful weapon could expunge entire enemy bases in seconds.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to expunge the coin from existence.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat threatened to expunge all life from the barren desert.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's mission was to expunge evil from the city.
